text: The last execution in Italy took place on March 4, 1947 in Turin, where three men from Sicily, Giovanni D'Ignoti, Giovanni Puleo and Francesco La Barbera, were shot at a rifle range just outside the city of Villarbasse. The three men had been condemned to death by the Turin Court of Assizes on July 5, 1946 (the last death sentence handed down in Italy) for clubbing to death ten people and throwing their bodies down a well on November 20, 1945, while committing a robbery at the farm where they lived, which netted the accused 45,000 Liras each. ==See also== #Capital punishment in Italy #Villarbasse ==References== https://web.archive.org/web/20090328235353/http://queenloana.wikispaces.com/Chapter+17 Category:1945 in Italy Category:Massacres in Italy Category:Mass murder in 1945 Category:Massacres in the 1940s Category:November 1945 events
title: Villarbasse massacre
